title: Restaurateur in Columbus, Ohio, Honored With Knighthood
teaser: The French government knighted a restaurant owner in Columbus for his friendship and service to World War II veterans.
contentencoded:
Not all the soldiers who stormed the beach at Normandy are in France today.

Some of them are at a French bistro in Columbus, Ohio, for an event to pay tribute to them and to honor the restaurant’s owner, who was named a knight by the French National Order of Merit.

From the Here & Now Contributors Network, Tony Ganzer of WCPN has the story.

  • WCPN: Columbus Restauranteur Knighted For Honoring Veterans

Reporter

  • Tony Ganzer, host and producer at WCPN. He tweets @tony_ganzer.
